text: The Massacre of Rabaa Between Narration & Documentation is an e-book documenting eyewitness testimony, pictures and names of Rabaa massacre victims in Rabaa al-Adawiya Square, Nasr City in eastern Cairo, Egypt on August 14, 2013. The first edition of the book was in Arabic, which was translated later and published in English. A second edition was also published in Arabic. This book has been relied on to determine the number of victims killed in the largest massacre of modern Egyptian history. == Contents of the book == * An introduction entitled: "The First Flow of Blood... a Paper," referring to the paper published by the Tamarod, an Egyptian grassroots movement that organized an uprising against Mohamed Morsi in 2013. * Chapter titled "Steadfastness in Dispersion Massacre" tells the testimonies of some witnesses during the Rabaa massacre, supported by pictures. * Chapter lists the pictures, names and addresses of 377 victims of the massacre, followed by a table of names and addresses of the rest of victims. The book mentions 802 victims. * Then the book ends with conclusions and references. ==References== Category:2013 Egyptian coup d'état Category:Books about Egypt Category:Egyptian Crisis (2011–2014)
title: The Massacre of Rabaa Between Narration & Documentation
